content:
3-3. If A is a class and x is a data attribute of A, client code using A SHOULD NOT directly access x.

Why is this true? I remember being told not to do this in OH for pset 4, but why not?
subject: Microquiz 2 3-3

content: <md>One of the purposes of classes is abstraction. Using `x` directly requires the user of class `A` to know the implementation details of `A` (i.e. what the attribute variables names are). Instead, getter and setter methods should be used to inform users how to interface with class `A`.</md>
